alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 11:32PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...SERIES OF STORMS TO BRING WARM AND WET CONDITIONS TO SOUTHWEST ALASKA MIDWEEK... A series of storms moving from the Bering Sea into the Chukchi Sea Tuesday through Thursday will bring southerly winds, warm temperatures, and mixed precipitation to Southwest Alaska next week. Expect temperatures to climb into the mid to upper 30s as far north as the Lower Kuskokwim Valley as moderate southerly winds move into the region. Precipitation type and timing remain uncertain, but rain and freezing rain appear likely throughout the region. The first system is expected to arrive on Tuesday, followed shortly by a second, warmer system Wednesday. Stay tuned to the forecast at weather.gov/afc as we refine the details in the forecast.

area.areaDesc: Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley
